hotspots.label: Rain Gauge Tube
hotspots.fact: This clear tube collects rainwater to measure how much rain falls. Scientists use rain gauges like this one to track weather patterns and help predict future storms!

hotspots.label: Collection Basin
hotspots.fact: The white cup at the bottom catches and funnels rainwater into the measuring tube above. This design helps make accurate measurements by preventing water from splashing out.

hotspots.label: Measurement Scale
hotspots.fact: The red numbers show inches of rainfall, helping scientists measure precipitation precisely. Most rain gauges measure rainfall in increments to track amounts from light drizzles to heavy storms.

hotspots.label: Wood Post Mount
hotspots.fact: The gauge is attached to a wooden post to keep it steady and level. A straight, stable position is important so rainfall measurements are accurate and not affected by tilting.
